title: Circular motion - tension in conical pendulum

content.question: A ball of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to a vertical pole by a rope and travels in a horizontal circle, as shown. The rope is attached to the top of the pole, has length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, and makes an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> with the pole. The ball travels with constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. Which of the following is a correct expression for the tension force in the rope?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m times v squared, and denominator L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mi>L</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m times v squared, and denominator L times the sine of theta, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m times v squared, and denominator L times, open parenthesis, the sine squared of theta, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m times v squared, times the sine of theta, and denominator L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mi>L</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m times v squared, and denominator L times, open parenthesis, the sine squared of theta, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi><msup><mi>sin</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
